Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Plausibly \Plau"si*bly\, adv. 1. In a plausible manner. [1913 Webster]
2. Contentedly, readily. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
The Romans plausibly did give consent. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

plausibly adv : easy to believe on the basis of available evidence; "he talked plausibly before the committee"; "he will probably win the election" [syn: {credibly}, {believably}, {probably}] [ant: {incredibly}]
